2 Su-34s covered by 2 Su-35s are flying towards their launch lines in the western Black Sea.
They may launch Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.
2 Su-34s covered by 2 Su-35s are flying towards their launch lines in the western Black Sea.  They may launch Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs at Odesa Oblast.
Correction: 4 Su-34s
Su-34 movements. Almost at the launch lines.
Su-34 movements. Almost at the launch lines.
Gaining altitude rapidly
Gaining altitude rapidly
Launch maneuvers have not been recorded.
Now launch maneuvers
No aerial targets are detected. The 4 Su-34s are circling west of Crimea.
They flew past their other launch lines (for Mykolaiv Oblast) near the Kinburn Spit, Kherson Oblast.
They flew past their other launch lines (for Mykolaiv Oblast) near the Kinburn Spit, Kherson Oblast.
They circled back and rapidly gained altitude again (10 km right now)
They circled back and rapidly gained altitude again (10 km right now)
Launch maneuvers
Grom-E1 rocket-powered glide-bombs are flying towards Zatoka, Odesa Oblast. Currently only 2 are detected.

Correction on the flight route: they were launched from the southeast.
2 glide-bombs are flying towards Hrybivka, Odesa Oblast.
2 more were launched, flying along the same route.
Correction on the flight route: they were launched from the southeast.  2 glide-bombs are flying towards Hrybivka, Odesa Oblast.  2 more were launched, flying along the same route.
The first two are ~18 km away.
The first two are ~18 km away.
The glide-bombs are still at a somewhat high altitude, they may fly further inland to Ovidiopol.
Explosions in the Zatoka - Karolino-Buhaz area.
The other 2 glide-bombs disappeared. The Su-34s and Su-35s have flown back past Crimea on an eastern course.
Now 4+ Geran-2 drones are flying to attack the same area.

Following the earlier KAB strikes, the southern suburbs/outskirts of Zaporizhzhia are under heavy MLRS fire. 
At least 6 strikes so far.
Following the earlier KAB strikes, the southern suburbs/outskirts of Zaporizhzhia are under heavy MLRS fire.   At least 6 strikes so far.
The MLRS strikes targeted the Balabyne area, just south of the city.

Repeated MLRS strikes and more launches. 16+ so far.
A Russian recon drone is operating over Balabyne, adjusting the strikes.

Russian Army Is Finishing Off Ukrainian Troops In Myrnohrad (Videos)
On December 17, the Russian military expanded its control in the center of the city of Myrnohrad, also known as Dimitrov, in Donetsk, breaking down most of the last defensive lines of Ukrainian troops besieged there.
The Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces is now reportedly working to clear the center of Myrnohrad. Remaining Ukrainian troops there are no longer fighting as organized formations, but rather in isolated pockets that are being eliminated one after another by Russian troops.
Organized defenses still exist in the northern part of the city, but will not likely hold up for long. The Tsentr Group of Forces is said to be advancing in the Brianka district there.
Read more 
HERE

Battle Of The Haichur: Russian Army Advances Near Stepnohirsk, Fights Ukrainian Forces In Huliaipole
In the Zaporizhzhia sector, Russian forces drove Ukrainian troops out of Herasymivka. In the Kharkiv sector, the Russian army is advancing towards Prylypka and Hrafsky while simultaneously advancing in Vovchanski Khutora. In the Pokrovsk sector, Myrnohrad is being cleared while Ukrainian reserves are transferred to Serhiivka and Hrishyne. 
The United States is privately urging Europe not to use these funds, threatening to demand their return.
Read more 
HERE

U.S. Army Hits Another Alleged Drug Boat As Trump Demands ‚ÄòEnergy Rights‚Äô In Venezuela (Video)
The United States military struck another drug trafficking boat in the eastern Pacific Ocean on December 17, as President Donald Trump accused Venezuela of illegally taking away ‚Äúenergy rights‚Äù from American companies.
The ‚Äúlethal kinetic strike‚Äù was carried out upon orders from Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, the U.S. Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) said in a statement posted to X.
‚ÄúIntelligence confirmed that the vessel was transiting along a known narco-trafficking route in the Eastern Pacific and was engaged in narco-trafficking operations. A total of four male narco-terrorists were killed, and no U.S. military forces were harmed,‚Äù the statement reads.

Tensions In Eastern Mediterranean: Greece, Israel, And Cyprus To Confront Turkey With Joint Force
Israel, Greece, and Cyprus are working on a fast response force with 2,500 troops to counter Turkish influence, Greek newspaper TA NEA reported on December 17.
According to the report, which cites top defense officials, Greece is considering implementing Israeli measures and offering a coordinated response mechanism to protect against potential threats from ‚Äúenemy states‚Äù.
The report explains that Israel, Greece, and Cyprus will have access to this force, which will have dedicated air and sea capabilities.
‚ÄúA Greek-Israeli rapid reaction force is not an alliance against anyone. It fills a strategic void. From Rhodes to Cyprus and Israel, platforms, pipelines, and electricity cables are exposed,‚Äù one of the officials told the newspaper.

The Vovchansk And Lyman Paradox: Why Polymarket Bets Are Still Up Against Cities Already Captured
Which cities under Russian control are not yet recognized by Polymarket? Which contracts will definitely not close in December? Which settlements must be captured to complete the clearance of Myrnohrad?
Predictive markets like Polymarket continue to serve as popular indicators of expectations related to the development of the military operation in Ukraine. As some contracts tied to the fall of settlements are resolved, investors‚Äô attention shifts to new hotspots. However, the frontline dynamics from late November through the first half of December were surprising, radically altering forecasts and demonstrating the impressive pace of the Russian advance on key sectors.
In this article, we analyze the operational situation in the most important sectors of the front from December 6 to 16 using current reports and data.
